summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between FBI and DOJ personnel coordinating the distribution of meeting invitations and RSVP questionnaires to victims and their attorneys in the Epstein case. The discussion involves confirming victim and attorney contact lists, clarifying duplicate entries, and logistical planning for a victim meeting.

persons.name: Bob Josefsberg
persons.context: Mentioned as an attorney whose office represents multiple victims; FBI personnel are waiting for his current client list.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Provided a list of clients; mentioned as a Victim Specialist obtaining the most recent list of clients from Bob Josefsberg.

connections.description: Brittany Henderson, a Victim Specialist, is obtaining a client list from attorney Bob Josefsberg.

events.title: Planned victim meeting
events.description: A meeting for victims was being organized, with invitations sent to attorneys and victims.

events.title: Email coordination on victim lists
events.description: FBI and DOJ personnel exchanged emails to confirm victim identities and contact information, resolving duplicate entries on their lists.

keyFacts: The communication reveals ongoing coordination between the FBI's Victim Services Division and the DOJ to contact victims and their attorneys for a meeting related to the Epstein case.
There were challenges with victim contact information, including duplicate entries on lists and uncertainty about current legal representation.
Invitations for a November 12, 2020 meeting were sent to 14 attorneys (to pass to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
The email chain shows internal procedural efforts, such as creating fillable PDF forms and removing metadata from documents, for victim communication.
